alert.note: Alert for Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 01 at 2:12PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow showers will affect southwestern Oxford... northwestern Cumberland...southeastern Coos...northeastern Grafton and northeastern Carroll Counties... At 212 PM EST...An area of heavy snow showers was along a line extending from 11 miles northeast of Pinkham Notch to 11 miles northeast of Lincoln...and moving southeast AT 40 MPH. Locations impacted include... Conway, Bridgton, Fryeburg, Bethlehem, Lincoln, Franconia, Pinkham Notch, Mount Washington, Waterford, Carroll, Gorham, Bartlett, Harrison, Madison, Denmark, Lovell, Jackson, Albany, Eaton and Chatham. This also includes... Crawford Notch State Park, North Twin Mountain, Franconia Ridge, Mount Jefferson, and Mount Madison. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this area of heavy snow showers. Travel is not advised during these heavy snow showers. Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the snow showers pass your location. If traveling pull off to a safe location.

area.areaDesc: Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Coos
